items.title: “Relaxations for the Impotent”: Ben Hecht’s Fantazius Mallare and the Contradictions of American Smut
items.excerpt: Howl ? Ben Hecht’s Fantazius Mallare (1922) is at turns obtuse, grotesque, and moralizing — and sought to provoke the obscenity trial of the century. Only it didn’t, quietly vanishing instead. Colin Dickey rereads this failed satire, finding a transcendent rhythm pulsing benea…
